snippet: Paul D. Ryan, the vice-presidential candidate, campaigned in a state that usually votes Democratic in presidential elections but seems more in play this year.
abstract: Paul D Ryan campaigns in his home state of Wisconsin, seeking to maximize his native appeal; Ryan’s addition to the Republican ticket comes as Wisconsin’s 10 electoral votes are becoming increasingly competitive in the closing phase of the presidential race.

byline.original: By TRIP GABRIEL and JEFF ZELENY
byline.contributor: Trip Gabriel reported from De Pere, Wis., and Jeff Zeleny from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Paul D. Ryan, the vice-presidential candidate, campaigned in a state that usually votes Democratic in presidential elections but seems more in play this year.

headline.seo: Ryan, Stumping in Wisconsin, Stresses Local Roots
headline.main: Ryan Plays Up Wisconsin Pride as Obama TV Ads Begin in State
headline.print_headline: Ryan Plays Up Wisconsin Pride as Obama TV Ads Begin in State
